Class Move

java.lang.Object
elements.Move
public class Move extends Object
Represents a move in a chess game, including details such as the start and end squares, the piece moved, move notation, and the resulting position after the move.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Move(Square start, Square end, int moveNumber, Piece movedPiece, String moveNotation, Position positionAfterMove)
    Constructs a Move object.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Move

    Gets the piece that was moved.
    String

    Gets the notation of the move in standard chess notation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Move

      public Move(Square start, Square end, int moveNumber, Piece movedPiece, String moveNotation, Position positionAfterMove)
      Constructs a Move object.
      Parameters:
      start - the starting square of the move.
      end - the ending square of the move.
      moveNumber - the number of the move in the game sequence.
      movedPiece - the piece that is moved.
      moveNotation - the chess notation representing the move, e.g., "e4", "Nxf3".
      positionAfterMove - the position of the board after this move is made.

  • Method Details

    • getStart

      public Square getStart()
      Gets the starting square of the move.
      Returns:
      the Square representing the starting position of the piece.

    • getEnd

      public Square getEnd()
      Gets the ending square of the move.
      Returns:
      the Square representing the destination of the piece.

    • getMoveNumber

      public int getMoveNumber()
      Gets the number of this move in the game's sequence.
      Returns:
      the move number as an integer.

    • getMovedPiece

      public Piece getMovedPiece()
      Gets the piece that was moved.
      Returns:
      the Piece involved in the move.

    • getMoveNotation

      public String getMoveNotation()
      Gets the notation of the move in standard chess notation.
      Returns:
      a String representing the move in standard chess notation.

    • getPositionAfterMove

      public Position getPositionAfterMove()
      Gets the board position after this move is executed.
      Returns:
      the Position object representing the state of the board after the move.

    • toString

      public String toString(Game game)
      Converts this move into a string representation. The string includes the resulting board state, the move number, and the move notation.
      Parameters:
      game - the current game context.
      Returns:
      a string describing this move.

    • copy

      public Move copy()
      Creates a deep copy of this move, including its associated pieces and board position.
      Returns:
      a new Move object that is a clone of the current move.
